com.shc.ahttp.client

Class SPostClient<REQ,RES>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.shc.ahttp.client.SPostClient<REQ,RES>

  • public class SPostClient<REQ,RES>
extends Object
    A Simple post client, which can be used to post request and receive response, by passing in directly request and response objects, which can be converted using a MessageConverter. The default message converter, if not one is provided explicitly us JacksonMessageConverter. The Simple post client uses AHttpPostRequest to make the post requests
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.0 $
    Author:
    vishalk2
    See Also:
    MessageConverter, JacksonMessageConverter

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean basicAuthRequired
      If username, password are not used during the construction of SPostClient object then this value will be set to false, there by skipping basic auth for the request sent.
      private int connectTimeout
      The connect timeout in milliseconds to be used
      private static Class<? extends MessageConverter> DEFAULT_MESSAGE_CONVERTER_CLASS
      The DEFAULT_MESSAGE_CONVERTER_CLASS which will be used if no other message converters are explicitly provided
      private String encoding
      The encoding of the request object to be posted and the expected encoding of response for ex UTF-8
      private Map<String,String> headers
      A Map of headers to be included in the request
      private boolean includeResponseHeaders
      A boolean value indicating whether to return the response headers also as part of the response object
      private MessageConverter messageConverter
      The message converter that will be used, if not set the SPostClient will resort to using the DEFAULT_MESSAGE_CONVERTER_CLASS
      private String password
      The password to be used for basic auth
      private REQ request
      The request object which is compatible with the MessageConverter being used
      private RES response
      The response object which is compatible with the MessageConverter being used and the incoming response will be constructed into this object.
      private Class<RES> responseClass
      The response class which is compatible with the MessageConverter being used and the SPostClient will try to generate response object based on this class
      private String url
      The full url to the resource to which the request has to be sent.
      private String username
      The username to be used for basic auth

    • Method Detail

      • postRequest

        public SClientResponse<RES> postRequest()
                                 throws SClientException
        Post the request constructed to the given url
        Returns:
        the SClientResponse object if the request was successfully sent and parsed * @throws SClientException During the client call if any exception has occurred or the response code is not between 100 - 399, capturing all the details from the reponse stream
        Throws:
        SClientException
